title: Calories in 1 Pound Ground Turkey
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 pound ground turkey, including protein, fat, carbs, per-100g breakdown, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
assumptions: 93% lean ground turkey, raw; no added fat, seasonings, or binders; 1 pound â‰ˆ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, brand, farming practices, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 pound of 93% lean ground turkey provides ~649 kcal and ~85 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use 85% lean instead of 93% (higher fat content)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 pound of ground turkey?
faqs.a: About 649 kcal for 93% lean, raw ground turkey.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1 pound ground turkey?
Does cooking change calories in ground turkey?
faqs.a: Cooking can reduce calories if fat is drained; expect ~10-20% less than raw.

faqs.q: How does lean percentage affect calories in ground turkey?
faqs.a: 93% lean: ~143 kcal/100g; 85% lean: ~180 kcal/100g; lower lean means more fat and calories.

faqs.q: Are carbs present in ground turkey?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain ground turkey; additions like fillers change that.
